original: QVISTGAARD, Jens Harald, Marinöverdirektör, Stockholm, f Gbg 22/9 95 av gross-handl J Q o Sigrid Ekblad, gm Ingrid Win-gren. Studex Örebro 14, avg.ex KTH (skepps-byggn) 18, marining.stip 18. Ing v AB Göta-verken, Anglo-Swedish Electric Welding Ca 1 London o Chantiers Navals Frangais i Caen 18—20, e. marining 20—22, v. vkst dir i Oskarshamns Mek Verkst & Skeppsdockas AB 24—27, marining av 2:a gr på stat 27, arb.chef v Kkrona örlogsvarv v bygg av jagarna Klas Uggla, Stockholm o Karlskrona samt minsvep :a Arholma o Landsort 29—39, l :e marining 37; chef f mtrlanskaffn o kontrollant v nybygg av minsvep :a Bremön, Holmön, Sandön, Ulvön, Vinga, Ven, Koster, Kullen, Bredskär, Ramskär, örskär o Grönskär, kustjag :a Mode, Magne, Mjölner o Munin samt de s k modifierade stadsjag :a Visby o Sundsvall 40— 42, marinöverdir, chef f marining.kåren o chef f marinförvaltningens ing.avd 42. Magistrats-besiktn.man o sakk v värdering av fartyg i Oskarshamn o Kkrona, sakk i sjöf.mål v råd-husr i Kkrona, av yrkesinsp godk besiktn.-man f ångpannor. Finl v. konsul i Oskarshamn 26—27. Styr.led i Sv Skifferolje AB, Örebro, ordf i 43 års örlogsvarvsutredn. Har i tjänsten besökt ett stort antal europ o utom-europ länder o hamnar, bl a som flottiljing f torpedbåtsfl 21—22 o f jagare 28—29, ss far-tygsing på pansarkryss Fylgias vinterexp 32— 33 o dess sommarexp 33. SHT, Frimurare. RNO, RVO, VGM, Off JugKrO, Off TunNI, LKÖS, LKKrVA. OQWÄKNSTRÖM, Sverre Arthur, Direktör, Ängby, f Bergen, Norge, 9/9 89, gm Kaia Om-budstvedt. Bokhdlsutbildn i utl. Bokhdl i Sandefjord o chef f fman Garmann Clausen där 18—23, vkst dir o styr.led i AB Garmann Clausen i Sthlm sed. 29.
translated:
QVISTGAARD, Jens Harald, Naval Director, Stockholm, b. Gothenburg 22/9 1895, to merchant J.Q. and Sigrid Ekblad, m. Ingrid Wingren. Graduated from Örebro 14, completed degree in shipbuilding at KTH (Royal Institute of Technology) in 1918, naval scholarship in 1918. Engineer at AB Göta Verken, Anglo-Swedish Electric Welding Co. in London and Chantiers Navals Francais in Caen from 1918-1920. Naval officer from 1920-1922, deputy managing director at Oskarshamn Mechanical Works & Shipyard AB from 1924-1927. Promoted to 2nd lieutenant in 1927, head of labor at Karlskrona Naval Shipyard for the construction of destroyers Klas Uggla, Stockholm and Karlskrona. Also involved in the construction of minesweepers Arholma and Landsort from 1929-1939, promoted to 1st lieutenant in 1937. Head of material procurement and inspector for the construction of minesweepers Bremön, Holmön, Sandön, Ulvön, Vinga, Ven, Koster, Kullen, Bredskär, Ramskär, Örskär, and Grönskär, as well as coastal destroyers Mode, Magne, Mjölner, and Munin, as well as the so-called modified city destroyers Visby and Sundsvall from 1940-1942. Naval director, head of the Naval Corps, and chief of the Naval Administration's Engineering Department in 1942. Magistrate inspection officer and expert in ship valuation in Oskarshamn and Karlskrona, expert in maritime cases at the town court in Karlskrona, and certified inspection officer for steam boilers. Honorary consul in Oskarshamn from 1926-1927. Board member of Swedish Shale Oil AB, Örebro, chairman of the 1943 Naval Shipyard Investigation. Has visited a large number of European and non-European countries and ports for official duties, including serving as a flotilla leader for torpedo boat flotilla from 1921-1922 and destroyer flotilla from 1928-1929, as well as serving as ship's officer on the armored cruiser Fylgia for winter expeditions in 1932-1933 and summer expeditions in 1933. Member of the Royal Swedish Academy of Sciences, Freemason. Knight of the Order of the North Star, Knight of the Royal Order of Vasa, Commander of the Order of St. Olav, Officer of the Yugoslav Crown, Officer of the Tunisian Order of Nichan Iftikhar, Commander of the Legion of Honour, Commander of the Royal Norwegian Naval Cross. 

OQWÄKNSTRÖM, Sverre Arthur, Director, Ängby, b. Bergen, Norway, 9/9 1889, m. Kaia Ombudstvedt. Educated in bookstore management abroad. Bookstore manager in Sandefjord and executive director of Garmann Clausen from 1918-1923. Executive director and board member of AB Garmann Clausen in Stockholm since 1929.
